data.title: 20 Best Disney Princesses: A Journey Through Magical Realms (2024)
data.meta_description: Explore the best Disney princesses, each with unique stories and characteristics. Discover which princess resonates most with audiences around the world.
data.text:
Disney has brought us countless memorable characters, but there's something extraordinary about the enchanting world of Disney Princesses.

From tales of true love to stories of female empowerment (yes, Mulan, we're looking at you), these iconic Disney heroines have captured the hearts of both kids and adults alike.

They've not only entertained us but also inspired generations as role models. But who is the best Disney princess? Here's our list of the best Disney princesses that left a mark on Disney fans!

Top 20 Most Popular Disney Princesses

1. Mulan

Known as: Bravest

Why We Chose Her: Mulan is one of the few Disney Princesses known for bravery and determination. Unlike traditional Disney princesses, she doesn't wait for a prince charming to save the day.

Instead, Fa Mulan disguises herself as a soldier to save her father and her country - a narrative of an independent woman, making her one of the most iconic Disney princesses ever.

Additionally, we like her love story with Li Shang and the theme song, "Reflection," sung by the famous singer Lea Salonga.

Take a peek at our list of the most popular Disney characters here.

Role Model Qualities:

Bravery in the face of danger (defeats Shan Yu)

Devotion to family and duty

Intelligence and resourcefulness

Ability to defy stereotypes and challenge norms

2. Belle (Beauty and the Beast)

Known as: Smartest

Why We Chose Her: Belle, from the Disney film "Beauty and the Beast," stands out for her love of reading, intelligence, and compassion.

She's not just one of the best Disney Princesses for her beauty but also her sharp mind and kind heart. Belle sees beyond appearances, showing us the importance of inner beauty and character.

Her fairy tale story (in Beauty and the Beast) is a beautiful blend of romance and personal growth, making her a timeless role model for viewers.

Be our guest and dine like royalty with our Disney Princess Dinnerware collection here!

Also Read: Beauty & the Beast Party Ideas

Role Model Qualities:

Love for learning and reading

Seeing beyond superficial appearances

Courage and compassion

Independence and strength of character

3. Tiana (Princess and the Frog)

Known as: Humblest

Why We Chose Her: Tiana, from "The Princess and the Frog," is a hardworking and ambitious Disney princess who encounters the frog prince - Prince Naveen.

She's an inspiration for her determination to achieve her dreams through perseverance and resilience. In fact, Tiana (of The Princess and the Frog) [1] is the first African-American Disney princess.

Tiana's journey from a waitress to a restaurateur encapsulates the essence of an independent woman, making her a unique and relatable Disney Princess.

Role Model Qualities:

Strong work ethic and determination

Pursuit of dreams despite obstacles

Resourcefulness and practical skills

Kindness and humility

4. Rapunzel (Tangled)

Known as: Cleverest

Why We Chose Her: Rapunzel, from the Disney movie "Tangled" (voiced by Mandy Moore), captivates us with her adventurous spirit and zest for life and her romantic love story with Flynn Rider.

She remains optimistic and eager to explore the world despite being confined her entire life (involving her evil stepmother, Mother Gothel).

Rapunzel's fairy tale symbolizes the quest for freedom and self-discovery. Her story is a testament to the idea that one's circumstances don't define one's future, making her a truly inspiring Disney Princess.

Role Model Qualities:

Optimism and positivity

Curiosity and love for adventure

Creativity and artistic talent

Emotional resilience

Also Read: Popular Disney Gifts For Women

5. Ariel (Little Mermaid)

Known as: Cutest

Why We Chose Her: Ariel from "The Little Mermaid" is one of the best Disney princesses, well-loved for her curiosity and boldness in pursuing her dreams.

This little mermaid has an adventurous nature, leading her to explore the human world - following her love interest, Prince Eric. So, her determination to follow her heart (Prince Eric) is inspiring.

Ariel's story encourages viewers to dream big and be brave, solidifying her status as one of the most cherished Disney Princesses. She's also the only Disney princess to have become a mother [2].

Role Model Qualities:

Courage to explore the unknown

Determination to pursue goals

Openness to new experiences

Resilience in facing challenges

6. Jasmine (Aladdin)

Known as: Loveliest

Why We Chose Her: Princess Jasmine, from the Disney version of "Aladdin" (Walt Disney Pictures), is a strong-willed and independent character.

Disney Jasmine challenges the constraints of her royal life, showing a desire to explore beyond palace walls and make her own choices, making her one of the iconic characters.

Her character breaks the mold of traditional princess roles, making her a powerful role model for audiences. Besides, we love the magic lamp and the theme song sung by Lea Salonga.

Role Model Qualities:

Independence and assertiveness

Compassion for others

Curiosity and intelligence

Courage to stand up for herself

Also Read: Our Favorite Disney Quotes

7. Merida (Brave)

Known as: Fearless

Why We Chose Her: We like Brave's Merida (daughter of Queen Elinor) for her fierce independence and bravery.

She defies traditional expectations and forges her own path - a symbol of self-determination and personal freedom.

Merida's character (the first Pixar princess) encourages us to embrace individuality and be courageous in pursuing our destinies, making her a unique and inspiring princess.

Role Model Qualities:

Strong-willed and determined

Skilled archer and horse rider

Passion for adventure

Willingness to challenge norms

8. Pocahontas

Known as: Kindest

Why We Chose Her: Pocahontas (the titular character) is the first Native American Disney Princess. We love her deep connection with nature and her courageous spirit.

Pocahontas is the only Disney princess to have her story inspired by a real person (a Powhatan woman) [3], bringing a powerful narrative about bridging cultural divides and seeking peace.

Her love for John Smith brought peace and unity before any battle could unfold. Her theme song, sung by Judy Kuhn, was good, too.

Role Model Qualities:

Deep respect for nature and the environment

Strong sense of justice and peace

Courage in the face of adversity

Wisdom beyond her years

9. Cinderella

Known as: Nicest

Why We Chose Her: Cinderella is an iconic Disney Princess, embodying hope and kindness.

Cinderella's transformation, aided by her fairy godmother, glass slippers, and true love's kiss, makes her journey a magical and unforgettable tale within the Disney world.

Despite hardships (involving her wicked stepmother), Cinderella remains optimistic, teaching us about the power of dreams and the rewards of perseverance.

So what's the theme in Cinderella?

Role Model Qualities:

Unwavering optimism in difficult times

Kindness to all, including her animal friends

Patience and grace under pressure

Belief in her dreams and aspirations

10. Aurora (Sleeping Beauty)

Known as: Prettiest

Why We Chose Her: Everyone likes Princess Aurora, a.k.a. Sleeping Beauty, for her grace and beauty. Her story, marked by the iconic spinning wheel, is a classic Disney tale that has captivated audiences.

The tale of Sleeping Beauty, featuring true love's kiss and the struggle against the evil Maleficent, symbolizes hope and the triumph of good over evil.

The journey of Princess Aurora, from Briar Rose to Princess and her awakening by Prince Phillip remains a beloved story among fans, showcasing the timeless themes of love and destiny.

Check out our popular Disney Princess gifts here.

Role Model Qualities:

Grace and poise

Optimism and hopefulness

Kindness and gentleness

Resilience in adversity

11. Snow White (Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs)

Known as: Fairest

Why We Chose Her: Snow White (the first Disney Princess) [4] is iconic for her innocence and kindness. We love her story, involving the seven dwarfs, the evil queen, and the infamous poisoned apple.

The tale of Snow White, especially her revival by true love's kiss, has charmed Disney viewers for generations, embodying the classic fairy tale spirit.

The gentle nature of Snow White and her ability to see the good in everyone make her a timeless character.

But how old was the prince in Snow White?

Role Model Qualities:

Innocence and purity of heart

Kindness towards all creatures

Optimism in the face of adversity

Grace under pressure

12. Anna (Frozen)

Known as: Goofiest

Why We Chose Her: Princess Anna from "Frozen" is well-loved for her lively spirit and unwavering love for her sister, Elsa.

We love her courage, humor, and heartwarming quest to reconnect with her sister, which speaks to how important family and self-discovery are.

Anna's story and her unique bond with Elsa have captured the hearts of many, making her an endearing and relatable princess.

We'd like to know, who's your favorite Disney villain?

Role Model Qualities:

Fierce loyalty to loved ones

Resilience in the face of challenges

Optimism and a positive attitude

Bravery and a sense of adventure

13. Elsa (Frozen)

Known as: Boldest

Why We Chose Her: Elsa from "Frozen" stands out for her journey of self-acceptance and her awe-inspiring ice powers.

Elsa's transformation from a fearful princess to a confident queen is both inspiring and empowering.

Her character, especially in her iconic song "Let It Go," symbolizes the power of embracing one's uniqueness, making her a standout figure among Disney Princesses.

Role Model Qualities:

Courage in facing and accepting oneself

Resilience and strength in overcoming fears

Sense of responsibility and leadership

Deep love and care for family

14. Moana

Known as: Strongest

Why We Chose Her: Moana (the first Disney Princess portrayed by a teenager) has an adventurous spirit with a deep connection to her island's culture.

We're impressed by Moana's bravery in venturing beyond her island to save her people, showing great leadership and determination.

Moana's story inspires Disney fans with her dedication to her goals and courage in overcoming obstacles, making her a unique and inspiring Disney heroine.

Role Model Qualities:

Fearlessness in the face of unknown journeys

Strong connection to her cultural heritage

Determination to protect and help her community

Independence and self-reliance

Also Read: How Many Disney Parks Are There?

15. Raya (Raya and the Last Dragon)

Known as: Most Wise

Why We Chose Her: Raya from Disney's "Raya and the Last Dragon" is the thirteenth official Disney Princess, revered for her bravery and leadership. She's a proud guardian of the Dragon Gem.

Her journey in "Raya and the Last Dragon" reunites a fractured land and seeks harmony, showcasing her as a figure of strength, determination, and unity.

We're amused by Raya's story, a powerful narrative that resonates, particularly in its depiction of a princess who is both a skilled warrior and a unifier.

Role Model Qualities:

Leadership in uniting diverse groups

Courage in facing formidable challenges

Dedication to restoring peace

Resilience and resourcefulness

16. Vanellope (Wreck-It-Ralph)

Known as: Naughtiest

Why We Chose Her: Vanellope, unique among Disney heroines, is the only princess from a game. Many fans like the spunky and rebellious spirit in "Wreck-It Ralph."

Her character arc from an outcast to a beloved leader in the game world showcases themes of acceptance and self-worth.

Vanellope's journey, full of humor and heart, inspires us to embrace individuality and to stand up for ourselves, making her a memorable and unconventional Disney character.

Role Model Qualities:

Perseverance in overcoming setbacks

Embracing one's uniqueness

Resilience in the face of adversity

Leadership and determination

17. Nala (Lion King)

Known as: Selfless

Why We Chose Her: Nala, while not an official Disney empress, is a pivotal character in "The Lion King."

Her strength, wisdom, and leadership qualities shine throughout the film, especially her determination to save her kingdom.

Nala's influence extends beyond the traditional princess archetype, representing a powerful and independent character who plays a crucial role in her community.

Role Model Qualities:

Courage and bravery

Loyalty to her community

Determination and assertiveness

Compassionate and caring nature

18. Megara (Hercules)

Known as: Sassiest

Why We Chose Her: Megara, from "Hercules," though not an official Disney heroine, stands out for her sass, independence, and complexity.

We like how her character breaks the mold with a more cynical yet profoundly emotional approach to life and love.

Megara's unique persona and journey towards trusting Hercules and opening her heart again make her a memorable and beloved character in the Disney universe.

Role Model Qualities:

Strong-willed and fiercely independent

Quick-witted and intelligent

Emotional depth and vulnerability

Resilience in the face of personal challenges

19. Esmeralda (The Hunchback of Notre Dame)

Known as: Flirtiest

Why We Chose Her: Esmeralda (although not an official Disney empress anymore) is a key figure in "The Hunchback of Notre Dame."

Her fiery spirit, compassion, and unwavering stand against injustice make her a symbol of resilience and empathy, leaving a lasting impact on viewers.

Esmeralda's character demonstrates the importance of fighting for what's right and caring for those in need, leaving a lasting impact.

Role Model Qualities:

Strong sense of justice and equality

Empathy toward marginalized individuals

Courage in standing up against oppression

Kind-hearted and caring nature

20. Kida (Atlantis)

Known for: Leadership Skills

Why We Chose Her: Kida, from "Atlantis: The Lost Empire," is not an official Disney empress, but we like her leadership, wisdom, and connection to the ancient culture.

She is a strong and capable ruler, deeply committed to the welfare of her people and the preservation of their heritage.

Kida's character brings a unique blend of mystery, strength, and cultural depth to the Disney universe, making her a compelling and inspiring figure.

Role Model Qualities:

Leadership and dedication to her people

Strong connection to culture and history

Courage and combat skills

Curiosity and willingness to learn

Note: The princesses are often chosen and ranked based on a combination of generic reasons that resonate with audiences.

FAQs

Which is the most loved Disney princess?

The most loved Disney princess is Ariel from "The Little Mermaid" for her adventurous spirit, curiosity, and iconic songs that resonate deeply with fans.

Other beloved princesses include Tiana (voiced by Anika Noni Rose) from "The Princess and the Frog," known for her inspiring story and determination; Cinderella, famed for her rags-to-riches tale and magical transformation (by fairy godmother), and Elsa and Anna from "Frozen," who captured hearts with their sisterly bond and unique adventures.

Who is the most badass Disney princess?

The most badass Disney Princesses include Mulan, the first princess based on a legendary figure and is known for her heroic actions in battle. Merida, voiced by Kelly Macdonald in "Brave," is celebrated for her archery skills and independent spirit. Moana, a titular character in her movie, is admired for her adventurous spirit and leadership.

These princesses stand out for their courage, intelligence, and skills, making them true symbols of bravery and strength in the Disney universe.

Who was the prettiest Disney princess?

The most prettiest Disney princess is Aurora of the "Sleeping Beauty" (voiced by Mary Costa). Her classic beauty, graceful demeanor, and the enchanting story that surrounds her enhance her appeal.

Other princesses noted for their beauty include Snow White, renowned for her victory over the Evil Queen, and Belle from "Beauty and the Beast," celebrated for her inner and outer beauty. Each princess brings a unique charm and elegance, contributing to their lasting popularity.

Check out our enchanting Beauty & the Beast gifts here.

Final Thoughts

Reflecting on Disney's array of princesses, from Mulan's heroic feats to Ariel's underwater adventures to Kida's mystical connection, each character provides unique qualities and inspiring stories.

Whether it's Belle's love for books, Jasmine's independent spirit, or Cinderella's story with the glass slipper, these princesses have touched many hearts worldwide.

For fans looking to bring a piece of this magic home, Toynk's Disney Princess collection offers a treasure trove of items.

So, dive into this enchanting world and find your favorite princess merchandise - a perfect way to keep the fairy tale alive!
